intro: Hieracium chaunotrichum, commonly known as the hairy hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, pastures, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. The flowers are yellow and bloom in late spring to early summer, producing a showy display that attracts pollinators.
